meeting_annotations.speaker: Rigoberto Hernandez, Johns Hopkins
meeting_annotations.transcript: So I guess I would throw in a pitch for one of the things that I heard and because I was trying to ask the question is that even in this world of machine learning and data science that we still want to extract new physics new physics or new knowledge perspectives at the scales that we don't have access to, whether that's the middle scales or whatever you want to call it. And that there's still room for that. I also heard some people saying that there was room for modeling for for whether it's a whole cell or whole organism or and and then using those models from which to extract new insight. And and that that it's not like at the exclusion of the other.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Rommie Amaro
meeting_annotations.transcript: And the other thing that I think is sort of permeating here also that someone said it might have been Catherine and Neil about the real need for and maybe also Shankar the the need for experimentalists and data scientists or theorists to really work even more hand in hand now so that these things can be sort of I guess integrated and developed you know as it goes.
meeting_annotations.other: She touches her forehead while speaking, appearing deep in thought.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Rigoberto Hernandez, Johns Hopkins
meeting_annotations.transcript: And if you want to use the word spiral feedback which I introduced that would resonate.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Rommie Amaro
meeting_annotations.transcript: Is that what that is? Yeah.
meeting_annotations.other: She laughs, indicating a friendly and informal rapport.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Rigoberto Hernandez, Johns Hopkins
meeting_annotations.transcript: Yeah so Rommie you didn't get to see my talk yesterday you didn't miss much.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Rommie Amaro
meeting_annotations.transcript: No I know it was a great talk.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Neel Shah (Columbia Chem)
meeting_annotations.transcript: I thought I think that concept really resonated and I think it really applies here quite quite aptly. I think I mean I like the term and yeah.
